trans-unit.source: Maintains object state and identity management for entity type instances and relationship instances.
<xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager> tracks query results, and provides logic to merge multiple overlapping query results.
It also performs in-memory change tracking when a user inserts, deletes, or modifies objects, and provides the change set for updates.
This change set is used by the change processor to persist modifications.
This class is typically used by <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectContext> and not directly in applications.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Data.Metadata.Edm.MetadataWorkspace"></xref>, which supplies mapping and metadata information.
Changes state of the for a specific object to the specified entityState.

Calling the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.ChangeObjectState%2A> method to change the state of an object to <xref:System.Data.EntityState.Deleted> does not cause related objects in a constrained relationship to be deleted.
Changing the state of an object does not affect related objects in the object graph.

When you change the <xref:System.Data.EntityState> of an entity object entry to <xref:System.Data.EntityState.Modified>, all the properties of the object are marked as modified, regardless of the current or original values.

When the <xref:System.Data.EntityState> of an entity object entry is changed to <xref:System.Data.EntityState.Added>, <xref:System.Data.EntityState.Deleted>, or <xref:System.Data.EntityState.Detached>, the relationship entries for the object are also updated.
The object for which the state must be changed.
The new state of the object.
The for the supplied entity.
When entity is `null`.
When the object is not detached and does not have an entry in the state manager.
-or-
When you try to change the state to <xref href="System.Data.EntityState.Detached"></xref> from any other <xref href="System.Data.EntityState."></xref>
-or-
When state is not a valid value.
Changes the state of the relationship between two entity objects that is specified based on the two related objects and the name of the navigation property.
Entries for the objects at both ends of the specified relationship must exist in the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager>.
This method is not supported for relationships based on a foreign key association.
The object instance or <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref> of the source entity at one end of the relationship.
The object instance or <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref> of the target entity at the other end of the relationship.
The name of the navigation property on source that returns the specified target.
The requested <xref href="System.Data.EntityState"></xref> of the specified relationship.
The <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the relationship that was changed.
When source or target is `null`.
When trying to change the state of the relationship to a state other than or when either source or target is in a state.
-or-
When you try to change the state of the relationship to a state other than or when either source or target is in an state.
-or-
When state is not a valid value.
Changes the state of the relationship between two entity objects that is specified based on the two related objects and the properties of the relationship.
Entries for the objects at both ends of the specified relationship must exist in the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager>.
This method is not supported for relationships that are based on a foreign key association.
For more information, see [Defining and Managing Relationships](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/2c92c097-56bd-4145-989e-16d92475ecda)
The object instance or <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref> of the source entity at one end of the relationship.
The object instance or <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref> of the target entity at the other end of the relationship.
The name of the relationship.
The role name at the target end of the relationship.
The requested <xref href="System.Data.EntityState"></xref> of the specified relationship.
The <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the relationship that was changed.
When source or target is `null`.
When you try to change the state of the relationship to a state other than or when either source or target is in a state.
-or-
When you try to change the state of the relationship to a state other than or when either source or target is in an state.
-or-
When state is not a valid value.
Changes the state of the relationship between two entity objects that is specified based on the two related objects and a LINQ expression that defines the navigation property.
Entries for the objects at both ends of the specified relationship must exist in the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager>.
This method is not supported for relationships that are based on a foreign key association.
The object instance or <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref> of the source entity at one end of the relationship.
The object instance or <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref> of the target entity at the other end of the relationship.
A LINQ expression that selects the navigation property on source that returns the specified target.
The requested <xref href="System.Data.EntityState"></xref> of the specified relationship.
The entity type of the source object.
The <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the relationship that was changed.
When source, target, or selector is `null`.
selector is malformed or cannot return a navigation property.
When you try to change the state of the relationship to a state other than or when either source or target is in a state.
-or-
When you try to change the state of the relationship to a state other than or when either source or target is in an state.
-or-
When state is not a valid value.
Returns a collection of <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> objects for objects or relationships with the given state.
The <xref:System.Data.EntityState> is a bit field, so state entries for multiple states can be retrieved in one call by doing a bitwise OR of more than one <xref:System.Data.EntityState> values.
An <xref href="System.Data.EntityState"></xref> used to filter the returned <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> objects.
A collection of <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> objects in the given <xref href="System.Data.EntityState"></xref>.
When state is .
Returns an <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the object or relationship entry with the specified key.

Use the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.TryGetObjectStateEntry%28System.Data.EntityKey%2CSystem.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry%40%29> method to return an <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry> object without having to handle the <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> raised by the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.GetObjectStateEntry%28System.Data.EntityKey%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref>.
The corresponding <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the given <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref>.
When key is `null`.
When the specified key cannot be found in the state manager.
No entity with the specified <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref> exists in the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager"></xref>.
Returns an <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the specified object.

Use the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.TryGetObjectStateEntry%28System.Object%2CSystem.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry%40%29> method to return an <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry> object without having to handle the <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> raised by the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.GetObjectStateEntry%28System.Object%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to which the retrieved <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> belongs.
The corresponding <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the given <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
No entity for the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> exists in the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager"></xref>.
Returns the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager"></xref> that is used by the specified object.

Calling the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.GetRelationshipManager%2A> method is the same as calling the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.TryGetRelationshipManager%2A> method, except that this method raises an exception instead of returning `false`.

Call the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.TryGetRelationshipManager%2A> method to avoid handling the <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that occurs when a <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> cannot be returned for the supplied entity.
The object for which to return the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager"></xref> for the specified object.
When a cannot be returned for the specified entity.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.Metadata.Edm.MetadataWorkspace"></xref> associated with this state manager.

The <xref:System.Data.Metadata.Edm.MetadataWorkspace> class is a central programming interface that you can use to interact with the Entity Data Model (EDM) metadata at runtime and in the context of an application.
The <xref href="System.Data.Metadata.Edm.MetadataWorkspace"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager"></xref>.
Occurs when entities are added to or removed from the state manager.
Tries to retrieve the corresponding <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the object or relationship with the specified <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref>.

Use <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.TryGetObjectStateEntry%28System.Data.EntityKey%2CSystem.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry%40%29> to return an <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry> without having to handle the <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> raised by the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.GetObjectStateEntry%28System.Data.EntityKey%29> method.
The given <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref>.
When this method returns, contains an <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the given <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref> This parameter is passed uninitialized.
A Boolean value that is `true` if there is a corresponding <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the given <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
A `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) value is provided for key.
Tries to retrieve the corresponding <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.

Use the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.TryGetObjectStateEntry%28System.Object%2CSystem.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry%40%29> method to return an <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry> without having to handle the <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> raised by the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.GetObjectStateEntry%28System.Object%29> method.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to which the retrieved <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> belongs.
When this method returns, contains the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the given <xref href="System.Data.EntityKey"></xref> This parameter is passed uninitialized.
A Boolean value that is `true` if there is a corresponding <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> for the given object; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager"></xref> that is used by the specified object.

The <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.GetRelationshipManager%2A> method is used to obtain the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> for objects that are persistence ignorant.

When objects implement <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithRelationships> or inherit from <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityObject>, the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> is accessed from the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithRelationships.RelationshipManager%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> cannot be returned when the object is in a <xref:System.Data.EntityState.Detached> state.

Calling the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.TryGetRelationshipManager%2A> method is the same as calling the <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateManager.GetRelationshipManager%2A> method, except that this method returns `false` instead of raising an exception.
The object for which to return the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager"></xref>.
When this method returns, contains the for the entity.
`true` if a instance was returned for the supplied entity; otherwise `false`.
